Reporting Bayesian Models

Source: R/report.stanreg.R
report.stanreg.Rd

Create reports for Bayesian models. The description of the parameters follows the Sequential Effect eXistence and sIgnificance Testing framework (see SEXIT documentation).

# S3 method for stanreg
report(x, ...)

Arguments

x

Object of class lm or glm.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

Value

A list-object of class report, which contains further list-objects with a short and long description of the model summary, as well as a short and long table of parameters and fit indices.

See also

Specific components of reports (especially for stats models):

  • report_table

  • report_parameters

  • report_statistics

  • report_effectsize

  • report_model

  • report_priors

  • report_random

  • report_performance

  • report_info

  • report_text

Other types of reports:

  • report_system

  • report_packages

  • report_participants

  • report_sample

  • report_date

Methods:

  • as.report

Template file for supporting new models:

  • report.default

Examples

library(report)

# Bayesian models
if (require("rstanarm")) {
  model <- stan_glm(mpg ~ qsec + wt, data = mtcars, refresh = 0, iter = 300, chains = 2, seed = 333)
  r <- report(model)
  r
  summary(r)
  as.data.frame(r)
  summary(as.data.frame(r))
}
